name: Medical Baseline Allowance
description: Extra low-cost energy allowance for customers with qualifying medical conditions requiring additional electricity or gas (including CPAP); also get alerted before Public Safety Power Shutoffs
fullDescription: The Medical Baseline Allowance program provides additional low-cost energy to customers with qualifying medical conditions that require extra electricity or gas, and includes priority notification before power shutoffs.
whatTheyOffer:
- Additional baseline energy at lowest tier rates
- 500 extra kWh of electricity per month
- 25 extra therms of gas per month (for heating)
- Advance notification of Public Safety Power Shutoffs (PSPS)
- Protection from disconnection during extreme weather
- Eligibility for free portable battery program
howToGetIt:
1. Have doctor complete Medical Baseline certification form
2. Qualifying conditions include: life-support equipment, heating/cooling for medical conditions, CPAP/BiPAP, electric wheelchair, etc.
3. Submit form to your utility provider (PG&E, SCE, SDG&E, etc.)
4. Recertify every 2 years (or as required)
5. Contact utility immediately if medical equipment is affected by outage
keywords: Medical Baseline, CPAP, BiPAP, oxygen, life support, electric wheelchair, PSPS notification, medical equipment, disability, low-cost energy
